wikipedia_page.main: Arline Usden (14 October 1937 – 3 August 2013) was a British journalist. She rose to be editor of The Lady

response: In November 2008, Bowles' great grandson, Ben Budworth, took the reins as publisher on behalf of the family and set about modernising its style. As part of this process, Budworth appointed Rachel Johnson as the magazine's ninth editor in September 2009. She took over from Arline Usden who became an editor at large. A Channel 4 programme, The Lady and the Revamp, screened in March 2010, followed the new editor in her quest to raise awareness of the magazine and increase circulation. Johnson's axing of The Lady Laughs, a cartoon series by Patricia Drennan that ran from 2000 to 2009, led to complaints by readers. In response, Johnson would reply with old issues of the magazine to show how bland it historically had been.
